intro: Senecio doria var. subdecurrens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf senecio, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often branched and covered in fine, soft hairs. The leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and gradually taper to a point, with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowering heads are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
